file_content.text: I--I'm under investigation for covering up a Republic espionage ring. My career is ruined!
It is best if we're not seen together.
It was Kelara's own folly that brought her death.
I have not forgotten the service you did me in dealing with Harez Bant. Dare I hope you've returned to aid me once again?
If the authorities learned of Kelara's folly, it would ruin the good name of this office, shut us down for months of investigation.
All the while, the resistance would be gaining strength.
The penalty for aiding a spy is death.
You need her silenced?
I'm glad we see eye-to-eye on this.
And?
Don't ask me to cover up a crime.
I'm not lying for you.
No, not cover up.
The penalty for aiding a spy is death. Kelara deserves no less.
I have been... considering how best to end this disaster. It should be quiet, quick. Something that can be blamed on the rebels, no questions asked.
I've got a talent for that.
Just tell me where to go.
Got it.
Let me call Kelara.
I will tell her you are to escort her to my colleague Garboza at the Imperial outpost. The route has many isolated spots, suitable for rebel ambush.
Oh. Is it time?
My dear, these are the guards I've engaged to escort you.
My dear, this woman will serve as your bodyguard on your trip to the outpost.
My dear, this is the bodyguard I've asked to bring you to the outpost.
Garboza asked me to thank you for your assistance at such short notice.
It's a dangerous route. You must obey me without question.
I expect cooperation.
Uh, of course, sir. Was there another attack? I cannot wait to be off this blasted planet.
One never knows what companions life's journey will provide.
A serendipitous meeting.
Ooh. A philosopher. This should be fun.
And I thought I wouldn't get in any sightseeing on Balmorra.
Should be fun.
If you call wandering through bombed-out factories sightseeing, you should have a blast.
Consider yourself honored.
A trifling job.
Oh, great. How long is this trip again?
You'll be safe with me.
Don't worry.
I certainly hope so.
Hello.
Likewise.
Go to the transit point, Kelara. They will meet you there.
Leave for the transit point now, Kelara. She will find you there.
He will meet you at the transit point. Wait for him there.
I love you, too.
Go, then. When you find yourselves alone, you can put an end to her treason--and my marriage.
You can count on my discretion.
It must be done quietly.
On it.
She has brought on her own death with her foolishness.
She deserves execution.
Just be... kind about it. I loved her once.
It is best our names not be linked after this. When the deed is done, go to Officer Garboza at the outpost. He'll have your reward; you need not say what it's for.
Any ten-credit hit man could kill an unarmed woman. You don't need me.
No challenge. [Refuse quest]
I meant no insult.
I, uh, don't suppose you know where to find a ten-credit hit man--nevermind.
You look satisfied. I hope it's because the wretched spy who stole my blaster designs lies dead on his own floor.
He died for insulting the laws of our Empire.
He's dead.
A far more worthy reason than any other crime.
You should not be so careless with your secrets next time.
You're lucky. He's dead.
I shall guard them as closely as I guard my heart.
Any other secrets he stole die with him.
His spying days are over.
And every husband in Sobrik can sleep better at night.
If you want the head, you've got to put it in the contract.
Did you want the head?
No. I'll, uh, take your word for it.
He surrendered your documents without the need for violence.
I let him go.
I... will not question your judgment. I'm certain you had reason to release a known Republic spy.
I have your data discs right here.
It's done.
You promised a reward.
I appreciate your service.
But what of Kelara? Did you question him as to her role in this... affair?
All he said was she's a lousy kisser.
You really want to know?
The boor!
But I won't linger on that image. It's clear Kelara's part in this was vital and willing.
I thought stopping the spy outranked saving your marriage.
I didn't get around to that.
True. Though with no proof to the contrary, I must assume Kelara is also guilty of espionage.
Without her help, would he even have known what to take?
She's guilty.
Yes. I can no longer deny Kelara's role in this.
If you haven't tired of my sordid tale, perhaps you could undertake one more task?
Forget it. I'm done.
True... and if you would wash your hands of my sordid tale, I understand.
But if you agree to take on another task, my gratitude would be unbounded.
I'd have to hear more about it first.
What is it?
Give me a reason.
This is a bit more... sensitive than dealing with Harez Bant. I could see fit to pay you triple what I would give otherwise. Consider it.
If I wanted more melodrama, I'd turn on a viewscreen.
I'm done. [Refuse quest]
Then please accept this for your services, and may we both long serve the Empire.
The Republic spy should bleed for what he's done. Perhaps Kelara as well.
Praise the Emperor!
My lord, you don't know the relief it is to see you.
You cannot know my relief to see someone of your known loyalty and... celebrated independence.
You are the answer to a problem that has gone from insulting me to threatening the entire Empire.
What do your problems mean to a Sith?
You dare seek my help?
Were I the only one affected, I would never presume. But we both serve the Empire.
Few people look at a Sith and see an end to their problems.
An unusual response.
And believe me, I would not normally seek such attention. But I beg your aid.
Does the problem have two legs and a price on its head?
Long as the answer's not free.
Precisely. I hear that's your specialty.
If you have actionable intel, just let me know.
Lay it out.
The story is... personal, so I'm counting on your discretion.
I'm listening.
You seem to have an inflated idea of your importance to the Empire.
Not a very big threat, then.
My name is Gann Sakoal. I'm a senior science officer here at Troida. Perhaps you've heard of my involvement in the Protactinian Bomber design?
No matter. It would only help you understand the sensitive nature of what I do, the secrets I'm privy to.
Let me guess, those secrets walked off with someone they shouldn't have?
Something get lost?
Indeed. Though that's a kind way to describe high treason.
Spit it out.
I save my respect for people who can hurt me.
Don't try to impress me.
You will hold me in even less esteem when I finish my tale.
My foolishness may have allowed a top secret design for our blaster power system to fall into Republic hands.
Why don't you start from the beginning?
What happened?
If you've violated your clearance, you're a traitor to the Empire.
I should turn you in.
I have done nothing! Save give in to passions better left to younger men.
Why should I care?
Hear me out, if only to judge my weakness.
I didn't hear my name once.
Hear my tale, if only so you may avoid the base passions to which I fell prey.
My father warned me. He said, "A pretty girl can do more damage with a smile than a Sith with a lightsaber."
But let me be direct. I am not the traitor. My wife is the one who betrayed first me, then our Empire.
Tell me her crime, so I can make the penalty fit.
She must be punished.
Details?
I should never have brought Kelara to this forsaken backwater. I was so hopeful when she finally stopped complaining....
That seems like more than a little lapse in judgment.
You married a traitor?
I don't know if Kelara did this out of malice or boredom. I shouldn't have brought her here. I finally thought I had made her happy....
But no, she found her own... entertainment. His name is Harez Bant. He's a thug, clears the trash at the cantina in Sobrik.
Imperial Intelligence believes he's a spy. And I am certain beyond doubt that he's the one who has the design plans that disappeared from my bedroom drawer.
If he's got those plans, he won't see tomorrow.
He'll answer to me.
I am truly honored by the service of so many of the Empire's finest.
Thank you, my lord. I cannot say what it means to have one of the very arms of the Dark Council on my side.
I was hoping you'd say that. Your reputation for... creative... justice precedes you.
Why only Harez Bant? Kelara should pay, too.
Your wife's still a traitor.
The plans must be recovered before Harez sells them to the Republic. He should be at the cantina now.
I will gladly give you as great a reward as I can muster should you dispose of this refuse.
Then, I will deal with my wife.
Fight him yourself or swallow your pride and report it. This isn't my concern.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
Not all of us are so free to act on our impulses.
If you have a requisition, please fill out the forms.
